talk.author: did:plc:2cyfml6xf666me3dnjd5bdgq
talk.utter: As the CEO of English, the contraction of mathematics is maths, not math ðŸ˜‰

talk.author: did:plc:oo7t7cy4un6yfapqy5lh6yg6
talk.utter: Actually, maths is an abbreviation, not a contraction.

talk.author: did:plc:2cyfml6xf666me3dnjd5bdgq
talk.utter:
Contraction
Grammar: A shortened version of a word, syllable, or group of words, created by removing internal letters and sounds. 

An abbreviation is a shortened form of a word or phrase, by any method including shortening, contraction, initialism (which includes acronym) or crasis.

talk.author: did:plc:2cyfml6xf666me3dnjd5bdgq
talk.utter:
Contraction
Grammar: A shortened version of a word, syllable, or group of words, created by removing internal letters and sounds. 

An abbreviation is a shortened form of a word or phrase, by any method including shortening, contraction, initialism (which includes acronym) or crasis.

talk.author: did:plc:oo7t7cy4un6yfapqy5lh6yg6
talk.utter: Oxford English Dictionary (OED), defines maths as a shortened form (abbreviation) of mathematics. It makes no mention of it being a contraction, as that term is reserved for cases like donâ€™t or canâ€™t.

talk.author: did:plc:2cyfml6xf666me3dnjd5bdgq
talk.utter: An abbreviation can be a contraction, and clearly meets the definition of a contraction as parts of the word has been removed
